answers.answer: i am sorry about your health problems.  it must be very taxing physically and mentally.  do you have support from nearby friends or neighbors?  it sounds like you probably see your health professional(s) on a regular basis, so i hope you bring up the problem of your level of exhaustion.  could it be bordering on depression?  that in itself could cause the drop in energy you're experiencing.  good luck and try not to loose faith :)

Boy, you sure have been through a lot, I'm so sorry you're going through so much. Are you on current med's for your diabetes or anything else? It doesn't sound like you're doc's are taking your symp's seriously enough. Could you also have Fibromyalgia or CFIDS/CFS? have you had your Thyroid and liver checked recently? Also depression, as mentioned, can really wreak havoc on us, especially if we're all ready dealing with other illnesses. And who wouldn't be depressed when feeling so badly. Glad you're here and posting though, you'll find the answers eventually, and you may want to check out the Marshall Protocol: marshallprotocol.com, its a treatment that many people who deal with many of the same symptoms and illnesses that you listed, and they're (we're) feeling better and even making full recoveries. Keep us updated on how you're doing!

question: I've had diabetes, emphysema, high blood pressure, and gout for several years and have learned to live with these ailments.  Lately I have lost all energy.   I tire from walking room to room.  All activity has stopped.  The morning shower exhausts me.  My ankles are swollen,  I have a planters wart on ball of one foot that gives severe pain,  I have three toothaches,  and I suffer from an inpacted kidney stone that has been there for many years.   Besides that I have Best Diesease, and my vision is +200/20.   I would gladly just close my eyes and let it be over.
title: Tired
